docs.title: Authentication Architecture v2
docs.content: Our authentication system uses OAuth 2.0 with JWT tokens. The login flow includes multi-factor authentication for enhanced security. Session management is handled via Redis with a 24-hour expiration.
docs.excerpt: OAuth 2.0 authentication with JWT tokens and MFA support

docs.title: PR #234: Fix Modal Overflow
docs.content: This PR fixes the modal overflow issue in the settings panel. Changed CSS to use proper flex container and added overflow-y auto to handle long content.
docs.excerpt: Fixes modal overflow in settings panel using flexbox

docs.title: Q4 Marketing Campaign Strategy
docs.content: Our Q4 campaign focuses on three key segments: enterprise clients, SMBs, and developers. We're launching a new content series highlighting customer success stories and technical deep-dives.
docs.excerpt: Q4 campaign targeting enterprise, SMB, and developer segments

docs.title: Component Documentation Guidelines
docs.content: All React components should include TypeScript definitions, prop documentation, usage examples, and accessibility notes. Use Storybook for visual documentation.
docs.excerpt: Guidelines for documenting React components with TypeScript

docs.title: Safari Troubleshooting Guide
docs.content: Common Safari issues include cookie blocking, local storage limits, and WebKit-specific CSS bugs. Always test with latest Safari version. For login issues, check third-party cookie settings.
docs.excerpt: Troubleshooting guide for Safari browser compatibility

docs.title: API Rate Limiting Implementation
docs.content: Implemented Redis-based rate limiting for API endpoints. Default limits: 100 requests per minute for authenticated users, 10 for anonymous. Uses sliding window algorithm.
docs.excerpt: Redis-based API rate limiting with sliding window
